intro: [WRONG START] Rubus × pseudoadscitis, commonly known as the evergreen blackberry. This hybrid plant is a member of the Rosaceae family and is native to the western United States. It is characterized by its dense, thorny growth habit and dark green, leathery leaves. The plant produces small, black berries that are typically harvested in late summer. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in woodland or coastal areas.
